definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent

sentences.english: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that an abundance of waters may cover thee?
sentences.chinese: 你豈能使你的聲音上達雲霄，使雨水沛然降在你處？

sentences.english: A minority of millions is not at all unusual.
sentences.chinese: 數量上達數百萬之衆的少數派比比皆是。

sentences.english: Many believe it's also the best time for their prayers to be heard.
sentences.chinese: 許多人相信這是自己的訴求上達天庭的最佳時候。

sentences.english: Samech. Thou hast set a cloud before thee, that our prayer may not pass through.
sentences.chinese: 你隱在濃雲深處，哀禱不能上達。

definition: to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
to learn/to acquire (some skill through practice)/acquisition
harmonious/to mediate/to reconcile/to compromise/mediation/to mix/to blend/blended/to season/seasoning/to placate
variant of 熱衷|热衷[re4 zhong1]
to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
to impair/to degrade/to decrease/to reduce/to weaken/to detract from/impairment (e.g. of financial assets)
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
